snippet: Business officials say advocacy groups often demonize companies unfairly and inaccurately, while the groups question why corporations have attacked such fledgling organizations.
abstract: Business groups and powerful lobbyists, backed by the restaurant industry, are fighting back against worker advocacy groups that have become a growing force amid the decline of traditional labor unions; business officials say groups unfairly demonize companies, and that they should face same federal strictures as unions.
lead_paragraph: Business officials say advocacy groups often demonize companies unfairly and inaccurately, while the groups question why corporations have attacked such fledgling organizations.

headline.main: Advocates for Workers Raise the Ire of Business
headline.print_headline: Advocates for Workers Raise the Ire of Business
